newsitem.title: FRANCE: GAN boss refuses to quit - newspapers.
newsitem.headline: GAN boss refuses to quit - newspapers.

text.p: Jean-Jacques Bonnaud, the chairman of state-owned insurer GAN, is refusing to heed a call by the government for his resignation, French newspapers said on Tuesday.

The government said on Monday it was asking Bonnaud to quit. The move came after finance minister Jean Arthuis announced the scrapping of a tender to privatise GAN banking subsidiary CIC and said neither tha GAN boss nor CIC chairman Bernard Yoncourt had helped to promote the sell-off.
"It would be as good as admitting he was guilty of misconduct," La Tribune business daily quoted one of Bonnaud's aides as saying of a resignation.
GAN was not immediately available for comment on Tuesday.
Neither GAN, whose full name is Groupe des Assurances Nationales, nor CIC would comment on the case on Monday.
